page.title: 07The Baptist Free Church
page.content: The Chapel was opened in 1833.The building was extended in 1873 with stained glass windows and clock tower. There are 2 services on Sundays, at 10-30am and 5-00pm. There is usually a congregation of about 70. On Sunday mornings there is also a Sunday School for the children. This takes place in a separate room whilst the main service takes place in the Chapel. A house group meets on a Monday evening to read the Bible and say Prayers. There is a women's fellowship and on a Thursday there is the Good News Club,a club for children. At present there is no Chaplain as the Chapel are finding it difficult to find a suitable candidate. The present lay preacher and secretary is Mr.M.Ashworth.
